metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1420 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: On desktop, Ubuntu UI Toolkit's StateSaver would serialise data on tmp/ files which an attacker could use to expose potentially sensitive data. StateSaver would also open files without the O_EXCL flag. An attacker could exploit this to launch a symlink attack, though this is partially mitigated by symlink and hardlink restrictions in Ubuntu. Fixed in 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1.

notes.Note: jdstrand> desktop only. On Touch apps are confined by apparmor and use their own application-specific TMP area

criterions.comment: ubuntu-ui-toolkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
